annotation.TEXT: As a minor note: While I find these Phobia-enemies to be really interesting in both premise and interpretations, I still have no idea why the embodiment of Arachnophobia was given a Mega Man buster.

Scotophobia is one of the more annoying of these bosses. He only has one move, but it can drain both your life and your stats (and in turn, adding them onto his totals). Unless you've leveled up enough to at least get Jump Shot, chances are this fight is going to be pretty rough.

Gynophobia is easily the most difficult of these bosses. Even though it doesn't look hard here (mostly on account of Death Trail), trust me when I say that this boss is pure evil. If you don't take her out quickly, you'll essentially be at the mercy of her several stun/paralyze/draining-based moves, all of which can deal 100+ damage.
Now that we're nearing the end, the only thing left before the final chapter is reaching the top of Devil's Peak - which incidentally, now has a series of boss rushes for us.

The fight with Straybow is far more difficult this time around. Regardless of what level you had him at, Straybow will always be at level 16 here - giving full access to all of his moves. You can stay relatively on-par with him if you have Hexaflange and Jump Shot, but Straybow's range and damage output will always be an issue.

There are two ways to beat the Acrophobia boss: The easy way is to run over and smack the Container once, causing all the remaining ones to break down. The other way is to kill all of the Acrophobia enemies before doing so - which may lead to them dropping Flame Armor afterwards (it isn't a guarantee that they'll drop it, and it might not be worth getting this late in the game, but I enjoy fighting all of these things regardless).

All of the bosses (and a few new enemies in this place) are based on different types of Phobias. If you managed to level up enough to get Hexaflange, these fights generally aren't too difficult, but they can still prove to be hectic and semi-luck based in certain regards. If you have Death Trail however, everything becomes ridiculously easy (and mercifully so, especially considering the last of these bosses).
